resources.string: Create an account by clicking here
Bronze Plan - R$39.90 - Annual: 12x of R$35.90 - Gym only
Silver Plan - R$69.90 - Annual: 12x of R$62.90 - Gym, Dance
Gold Plan - R$109.90 - Annual: 12x of R$71.99 - Gym, Dance, Pool

Arm and Back:

•Fixed bar or graviton bar 5 sets 8-10 reps

•Alternate curl - 4 sets 8-10 reps

•Direct curl on cable - 3 sets 8-10 reps

•High pull 3 sets 8-10 reps

•Rowing Triangle Drop 4 Sets 8-10 reps

•Scott Curl: 3 Sets 10-reps

Chest and Triceps:

•Bench press – 5 sets 8-10 reps

•Dumbbell incline bench press – 4 sets 8-10 reps

•Rope triceps press – 3 sets 8-10 reps

•Lateral raise – 3 sets 8-10 reps

•Peck deck fly – 3 sets 8-10 reps

Leg and Abs:

•Squat 5 Series 8-10 reps

•Leg Press 4 Series 8-10 reps

•Extensor 3 Series 8-10 reps

•Abdominal crunch machine 3 Series 8-10 reps

•Oblique Abdominal machine 3 Series 8-10 reps

Repeat Arm and Back:

•Fixed or graviton bar 5 sets 8-10 reps

•Alternate curl - 4 sets 8-10 reps

•Direct curl on cable - 3 Sets 8-10 reps

•High pull 3 Sets 8-10 reps

•Low Triangle Row 4 Sets 8-10 reps

•Scott Curl: 3 Sets 10-reps

Repeat Chest and Triceps:

•Bench Press – 5 Sets 8-10 reps

•Dumbbell Incline Press – 4 Sets 8-10 reps

•Rope Triceps Press – 3 Sets 8-10 reps

•Lateral Raise – 3 Sets 8-10 reps

•Peck Deck fly – 3 sets 8-10 reps

Repeat Leg and Abs:

•Squat 5 Series 8-10 reps

•Leg Press 4 Series 8-10 reps

•Extensor 3 Series 8-10 reps

•Abdominal crunch machine 3 Series 8-10 reps

•Obliquous Abdominal Machine 3 Series 8- 10 reps

Foods that help gain muscle mass:

•High in protein: meat, fish, eggs and chicken. For vegetarians and vegans: beans, peas, chickpeas, lentils, soybeans.

•Rich in carbohydrates: rice, pasta, potatoes, cassava, yams, bread, tapioca and fruits.

•Rich in “good fat”: extra virgin olive oil, avocado, and oilseeds (nuts, walnuts, almonds).

•The main sources of vitamins and minerals: fruits, vegetables and leafy vegetables.

Foods for your dinner:

•Option 1: chicken crepioca (eggs and tapioca).

•Option 2: tuna pate or chicken sandwich.
 
•Option 3: omelette with carrots, peas and corn.

•Option 4: chicken wrap (or flatbread), with lettuce and tomato.
